sentence.Network_en: You wanted him as the bridegroom, not as the officiating cleric.

sentence.Network_en: His friends now wondered at the cleric and very official - looking nature of his position.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的朋友们对他这么伏案疾书不胜惊异.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from ecclesiastical Latin clericus 'clergyman', from Greek klērikos 'belonging to the Christian clergy', from klēros 'lot, heritage' (Acts 1:26)

entry.def: A cleric is a member of the clergy.

example.ex: His grandfather was a Muslim cleric.
example.tran: 他的祖父是一名穆斯林阿訇。

means.word_mean: 1. a clergyman or other person in religious orders

sentences.en: "I can't wait to hear him talk about world starvation," commented one of the clerics.
